data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:
Popular Toronto Host Suing Station After Being Fired For His Private (S)ex Life

Says He Was Fired Because CBC Thought His (S)ex Life Was 'Unbecoming' Of The Public Broadcaster

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– 'Q' radio host Jian Ghomeshi (R) says he has been fired from the CBC because they believed 'his sexual behavior was unbecoming of a prominent host'' on the public broadcaster. According to hrreporter.com, Ghomeshi made the claim in a Facebook post Sunday that surfaced just hours after CBC issued a statement saying they were severing ties with the popular personality because of information'' they'd received about him. After that announcement, a Toronto law firm representing Ghomeshi issued a brief statement saying it would launch a lawsuit against the CBC. Ghomeshi posted "I've been fired from the CBC because of the risk of my private (s)ex life being made public as a result of a campaign of false allegations pursued by a jilted ex girlfriend and a freelance writer,'' wrote Ghomeshi. CBC says the decision to cut ties with Ghomeshi was 'not made without serious deliberation'' and that it would contest a lawsuit if served with legal documents. It declined to comment on the Facebook post, citing the pending suit. In his FB post, Ghomeshi said he has always been interested in a variety of activities in the bedroom'' but only engages in '(s)exual practices that are mutually agreed upon, consensual, and exciting for both partners.'' Ghomeshi said he has been open with CBC about the matter and that he has never believed it was anyone's business' what he does in his private affairs but he wanted his bosses to be aware of the situation. He wrote, 'On Thursday I voluntarily showed evidence that everything I have done has been consensual. Toronto law firm Dentons Canada LLP says the action will claim general and punitive damages for breach of confidence and bad faith in the amount of $50 million. The law firm said documents would be filed on (yesterday) in court but did not elaborate. `Q,'' which launched in 2007, is also broadcast on over 180 NPR/PRI stations and syndicated in the U.S. READ FULL ARTICLE HERE

MOTION: Lulu & Lala Fill Afternoons On HITS 97.3 Miami; KOSI Denver Shuffles Lineup - Jonathan Wilde Moves To Mornings; Dom Giordano Extends With Talk Radio 1210 WPHT Philadelphia; Kramer Takes Over Afternoons At WIOT/Toledo; Talus Knight Joins KKND/NOLA As PD/PMD

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– Lulu and Lala take afternoons on Cox Media Group Miami’s HITS 97.3 WFLC FM, beginning Nov. 10. Twin sisters Marissa and Marianela Gonzalez most recently worked as co-hosts on the “Ty Loves NY” morning show on WNOW-FM in New York. The Cuban-Salvadorian sisters, who are also known in the Hispanic market as “Las Gemelas Lulu y Lala,” first appeared on Univision’s reality show Nuestra Belleza Latina in 2007. They were also on air for “The Luis Jimenez Show” on X96.3 FM, through Univision Radio in New York. ########## Lineup changes at Entercom's Lite Rock KOSI-FM/Denver. Jonathan Wilde will now take over mornings, Former hostt, Denise Plante moves to middays and her co-host Murphy Huston will head to weekend programming. ######### Talk Radio 1210 WPHT announced that Dom Giordano’s contract has been extended. Giordano will continue in the 9a-12noon slot on 1210AM, online at www.cbsphilly.com, and through the Radio.com app available for a variety of mobile devices. “Dom has been a staple of Philadelphia Talk Radio for over 25 years and is a cornerstone of WPHT. We are pleased that Dom will be with us for years to come,” said Marc Rayfield, Senior Vice President, CBS RADIO Philadelphia. ######### Kramer (R) announced via Facebook: "We're heading to Toledo, OH. I will do the afternoon show on WIOT 104.7 in Toledo, OH and another rock station based in Ohio. Will be starting some time early November. Met the staff this past weekend, and I can't say enough awesome things about them. ########### Cumulus announces that Talus Knight joins Rhythm-formatted KKND in New Orleans as Program Director and Afternoon On-Air Host. Knight moves to KKND from WFXM-FM in Macon, GA, where he developed his morning show while serving as Operations Manager for the Urban Mainstream, Adult Contemporary and Gospel stations in the cluster. Knight brings years of experience on-air and in programming positions for stations including WCDX-FM in Richmond, VA; WENZ-FM in Cleveland, OH, and WHAT-FM in Atlanta.

iHeartRadio Takes Swift's '1989 Secret Sessions' To The Roof

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– Monday evening iHeartMedia hosted "Taylor Swift's 1989 Secret Session with iHeartRadio." The exclusive event featured a performance by Taylor live for fans on a private New York City rooftop to celebrate the release of her new album, 1989, which debuted yesterday. Taylor kicked off the performance with "Welcome to New York" and continued with "Out of the Woods," "Style," "Blank Page" and closed with her hit, "Shake It Off." The lucky audience was filled with fans she handpicked from her fan club to attend this final Secret Session. Plus, for fans on the rooftop and throughout New York City, Empire State Realty Trust, Inc. also synchronized the world-famous LED tower lights on the Empire State Building to Taylor's performance, which broadcast on iHeartMedia CHR stations throughout the country as well as streamed iHeartRadio.com and Yahoo Live. Photo by Kevin Mazur/TAS/Getty Images for TAS

CBS Radio Wraps Up Second Annual 'We Can Survive' Concert

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– CBS RADIO hosted its second annual 'We Can Survive' concert event on Friday, Oct. 24 at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles. Among its many star performers included Pharrell Williams, Ariana Grande, Alicia Keys, Taylor Swift, Lady Antebellum, Iggy Azalea, Paramore and Sia performed with a special appearance by Gwen Stefani, and surprise guest Jennifer Lopez. Show above from L-R are Jim Burruss SVP, Promotion/Marketing Operations, Columbia Records, Kevin Weatherly

SVP, Programming, CBS RADIO, Michael Martin, SVP, Programming and Music Initiatives, CBS RADIO, Pharrell Williams, Amy Stevens SVP, Strategic Events and Partnerships, CBS RADIO, Chris Oliviero, EVP, Programming, CBS RADIO, Joel Klaiman, GM / EVP Columbia Records

Sun Broadcast Group And Gow Media Kick Off Yahoo! Deportes Radio

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– Sun Broadcast Group and Gow Media announced today a new partnership to provide Spanish language sports updates to stations across the country. Yahoo! Deportes Radio updates will be the only hyper-localized sports report offered to Spanish language stations with a major national sports brand. Sun Broadcast’s Hispanic division, Sun Latino, will handle advertising and affiliate sales. Gow Media, owner of Yahoo! Sports Radio, will handle production and distribution from its facilities in Houston, TX.“I’m so impressed by what David Gow, Craig Larson and their team have accomplished over the last few years,” said Jason Bailey, CEO of Sun Broadcast Group (L). “Gow Media’s Yahoo! Sports Radio has been a huge success by every measure. I’m thrilled to be working with them to bring the same quality of local, interactive sports reports to the Hispanic community.” In addition to a station’s local sports teams, Yahoo! Deportes Radio will take a deeper look at sports affecting the Hispanic community that have been lacking attention on radio including Mexican League Soccer, Boxing and CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer. Yahoo! Deportes Radio is available immediately. Stations should call Ron Rivlin at Sun Broadcast Group to reserve their market at 800-871-6163 or email at rrivlin@sunbgi.com.

FORMATICS: iHeartMedia Portland Debuts Tailgate Country – Commercial Free

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– iHeartMedia Portland announced today the debut of The All New Tailgate Country @ 103-7. The new station will offer listeners 100% commercial free music, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. "Tailgate Country features the hottest contemporary Country artists and no commercials," said Cumulus announces that Talus Knight joins Rhythm-formatted KKND in New Orleans as Program Director and Afternoon On-Air Host. Knight moves to KKND from WFXM-FM in Macon, GA, where he developed his morning show while serving as Operations Manager for the Urban Mainstream, Adult Contemporary and Gospel stations in the cluster. Knight brings years of experience on-air and in programming positions for stations including WCDX-FM in Richmond, VA; WENZ-FM in Cleveland, OH, and WHAT-FM in Atlanta. Senior Vice President of Programming for iHeartMedia. "It’s the perfect station for crankin’ up while sitting on your tailgate and watching The Ducks pull out another win. No-one in Portland is playing more Country music than The New Tailgate Country.” “Country music appeals to every demo and Tailgate Country 103.7 is an excellent addition to our existing portfolio,” said Robert Dove, Market President, iHeartMedia Portland. “We are really excited to bring a new flavor of country music to Portland.”

Winners Announced For U.S. Best Classic Rock Radio Stations

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– Team Rock Ltd, Classic Rock magazine and KMG Networks, a division of Krantz Media Group, have announced the first-­âtime winners of the US’s Best Classic Rock Station in the Large, Medium and Small Market categories. The Radio Station awards will be presented at a special VIP pre-­âevent ceremony on November 3 in Los Angeles, and the winners will be acknowledged from the stage of the awards event, which will take place at Avalon in Hollywood on Tuesday, November 4, hosted by Sammy Hagar. The Award winners are: Best Classic Rock Station, Large Market: 100.7 “The Sound” – KSWD-­âFM, Los Angeles, CA Best Classic Rock Station Medium Market: 100.3 “The Bay” – WZBA-­âFM, Baltimore. MD Best Classic Rock Station, Small Market: 104.7 WTUE-­âFM -­â FM Dayton, OH “Some of the greatest music ever made lives on every day on great radio stations across the US,” said Ian Williamson, Head of Events & Partnerships at TeamRock. “We are thrilled to have created this first ever award saluting the Best Classic Rock stations in America.” “It’s a distinct and high honour to join our partners at TeamRock and Classic Rock magazine in recognizing these great radio stations that keep the rock and roll passion alive in their cities every day,” noted Gary Krantz, President and Chief Executive Officer, Krantz Media Group. “Because of the music they play, their on-­âair personalities and their engagement with their communities, their listeners have spoken.” Presented by TeamRock and Classic Rock magazine, this is the 10th anniversary of the highly respected Classic Rock Roll Of Honour, and the first time it is being held in the US. Multi-­âplatinum Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame inductee Sammy Hagar will host the ceremony.

OUCH: New Orleans Station Starts #SaveSmitty Campaign For Slumping Falcons To Keep Their Head Coach

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– If you're a Atlanta Falcon's fan, continue reading with caution - this could hurt. Following this past weekend's New Orleans Saints win over the Green Bay Packers, they now have a chance to gain control of NFC South. This brings up their longtime rival The Atlanta Falcons whose lackluster 2-6 season gives the Saints great hope for them to keep this drive alive when they meet on the road. As added insurance they'd like to see its coach, Mike Smith, remain in place at least until they meet. Cumulus' FM 106.1 The Ticket/New Orleans decided to aid this effort with the launch of its #SaveSmitty campaign. The Falcons have lost their last five games, including a 21-point meltdown this past Sunday in London against the Detroit Lions. To be fair, the Falcons bested the Saints in their last meeting, but now with a number of sports analyst wondering about the future of Smith's role as head coach, this latest effort has not only caught the attention of Saints fans, but has garnered national attention as well. Check out all the #SaveSmitty tweets HERE.

iHeartRadio Launches Exclusive Manilow Station

Coincides Release of Manilow’s latest album, MY DREAM DUETS

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– iHeartMedia announced today that it has launched the Barry Manilow Music Station on iHeartRadio, its all-in-one streaming music and digital service. The exclusive station features the works of GRAMMY®, TONY® and EMMY® Award-winning musician Barry Manilow, as well as Manilow’s favorite songs from other artists with commentary by the pop legend. The iHeartRadio Network will also launch a DAIP (Digital Artist Integration Program) across its Adult Contemporary digital stations supporting Manilow’s latest album, MY DREAM DUETS featuring the duet with Whitney Houston, “I Believe In You And Me.” "Barry Manilow is a national treasure and we are honored to have the opportunity to launch this special channel for our listeners to enjoy songs from his legendary catalog and his personal favorites from other artists," said Darren Davis, President of iHeartRadio. The iHeartRadio Barry Manilow Music Station launch coincides with the October 27 release of Manilow’s latest album, MY DREAM DUETS. Modern technology has given Manilow the opportunity to record his “dream” duets with his own musical heroes.

Westwood One Sports Hosts Talk A Walk On Abbey Road

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– Speaking of the Atlanta Falcons, there at Wembley to cover this past Sunday's game were Westwood One Sports hosts Mark Malone and Dave Sims. And it wouldn’t be a trip to London without the proverbial walk across Abbey Road! Malone (L) and Sims took their stroll across this iconic street, immortalized forever by the Beatles, this past weekend while in town to broadcast Westwood One’s coverage of the Lions/Falcons game from Wembley Stadium. Let it be!

Des Moines Host Adopts Puppy Jake Foundation With Charity Drive For Veterans

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 28TH, 2014 –– News Radio 1040 WHO/Des Moines Afternoon Drive host, Simon Conway (above right) pulled off a fundraising victory when his audience stepped up for BBQ! Conway's show has adopted the Puppy Jake Foundation as his show's charity. They acquire, raise and train service dogs for physically and mentally wounded military and hand them over to the Veterans for free. Conway managed to get a local supermarket to donate 200 LBS of meat, convinced a bakery to provide 800 buns and even got a Champion BBQ King to do the grilling. Then he held the cook out - while on the air - in the front parking lot of the WHO studios... and in just two hours raised $4,000! "The audience were incredible," Conway said. "We were non stop with people driving through, picking up sandwiches and throwing heaps of cash in the donation buckets." Also on hand were dogs... lots of them! "We had three nine week old puppies that looked like they just left the set of a toilet tissue commercial, the first dog to have been given to a Vet, Puppy Jake himself and even my own Choc Lab, Reagan."

Orlando Host Recovering From Enterovirus D68

"It's Day 9 in the EV-D68 hospital isolation ward. Three nurses just walked into my room in full biohazard gear

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 27TH, 2014 –– Cox Media/WDBO Orlando host, Joe Kelly, had become Orange County's first official victim of the Enterovirus D68, and now post a photo the station's website (R) of the hospital where he was admitted on Friday, October 17th. He blogs:I have been placed in an isolation ward. I sit alone, on my hospital bed, where sticky tabs and wires monitor my heart rhythm, an IV drip runs cold into a vein in my arm (see photo below) and I continue to breathe oxygen through the assistance of a thin, green tube connected to a shiny, metallic wall plate. I'm powering through hospital food, trying to recall where I've placed my urinal bedpan, wheezing, coughing and going through episodes of extreme sleepiness and sober awareness. I'm missing contact with my wife and kids, my friends from work and my dog. I even miss my dog. I knew that last Friday was going to be unique because I felt my body waking up prior to my already-early 2:30 AM alarm. I felt the nagging chills of a fever. No amount of hogging the blankets would satisfy my chills. I stumbled to the bathroom; fumbled through the medicine drawer and found the family thermometer. It was bad. 102.9°. As a two-time cancer survivor, that kind of fever is not acceptable. Compounded with the fact that I lost my infection-fighting spleen in one of those cancer battles, I knew I had no choice but to get to the nearest emergency room. Fortunately, in spite of my delirium, I was able to safely drive to the local neighborhood hospital and quickly find the ER. Within moments of stumbling into the ER, I was peppered with questions about West Africa and whether or not I've been traveling in recent days. The ambient noises of the ER fell quiet as other staff and patients considered the possibility that Ebola had just walked in off the streets of Orlando.' Fortunately, he said by Sunday things were under control. But the bloodcurdling-coughing and associated pain continues to this day, a full 8 days later (Sat. 10/25). He adds that he's looking forward to getting his appetite back, enjoying food again, being able to hug my children and my wife, and of course, getting back to work. Until such time, remember to wash your hands… like… 1000 times a day. SEE FULL PIECE HERE - Joe.Kelley@coxinc.com

Westwood One News Announces Its New Team Of Reporters

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 27TH, 2014 –– Westwood One today announced that its new customized news product--Westwood One News, a next-generation, full-service news network powered by CNN has built an award-winning news team featuring top correspondents. CNN Correspondent Steve Kastenbaum (L) will be joining Westwood One News as Senior Correspondent and New York Bureau Chief. Bob Costantini of NBC News Radio (2nd from left) will become the network's Washington correspondent, covering the White House and Capitol Hill. Veteran CNN broadcast journalist Jim Roope (2nd from right) joins as the network's West Coast correspondent based in Los Angeles. And Alan Scaia (R) will serve as the Midwest reporter based in Dallas. "Westwood One News will launch with national coverage from some of the most experienced and honored news correspondents in our business,'said Bart Tessler, Westwood One's EVP, News and Talk. "They will be on the scene covering breaking news, filing for the network, and providing live two-ways with affiliates. We are proud to have them on our team and we look forward to more exciting WWO News announcements soon." 1

Local Talent & Content Key To Defending Internet Radio In The Dashboard Says Consultant

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 27TH, 2014 –– 'The way to compete is to continue to invest in local talent and great local content," says Jacobs Media's Paul Jacobs. He added: "People don't listen to stations, they listen to personalities." According to detroitnews.com, AM-FM stations face a tipping point as Apple CarPlay, Google's Android Auto, and in-car Wi-Fi hot spots fundamentally change the user interface in vehicles from radio to Internet. "The center stack has changed from two dials and three buttons to very complex systems that contain so many different options," says Jacobs, vice president of Jacobs Media. "The radio industry needs to work very hard to make sure radio remains vital in the car of the future." On the heels of its second annual DASH conference in Detroit last week, other broadcast operators weighed in on the topic: "It's a much more competitive landscape," says Steve Chessare, who manages Detroit's WRIF-101.1 FM, WCSX-94.7 FM, and Sports Radio 105.1 — for Greater Media. "It's more important than ever to create content that people want to engage in." Writer Henry Paine notes that every new generation GM vehicle will come with a Wi-Fi hot spot that will allow up to seven devices to connect directly to the Internet. Hyundai Sonata's will be the first car compatible with Apple CarPlay and Android Audio so that drivers can plug in their iPhones and mimic their interface on a vehicle's screen. According to Jacobs Media, half of radio listening is in the car, with that percentage increasing with each new generation. For example, 45 percent of baby boomers get their radio fix in the car compared to nearly 60 percent of Generation Y. One-fifth of cars on the road are "connected" via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi. With 90 percent of Gen Y drivers carrying a smartphone — versus 65 percent of baby boomers — in-car connectivity for new cars is a must.

Boston Legend Dale Dorman Passes Away

THE MOUTH 27TH, 2014 –– Dale Dorman who began as a top 40 jock in the '60's & '70's 1960s and 1970s then later playing those same songs as oldies, died at home last week after a long illness. A private service for family and friends was held Friday. According wcvb.com, Dorman came to Boston in 1968, working at WRKO for 10 years. He worked at KISS 108 for over 20 years and finished his career at WODS. "Dorman is one of those jocks who made it big in the RKO chain of stations back when personality really mattered. Once the Morning Show host at WRKO in it’s top 40 heyday, Dorman also spent time doing West Coast top 40 (KFRC)," KISS 108 wrote on its website. Dorman was inducted into the Massachusetts Broadcasting Hall of Fame in 2010. Dorman is survived by his wife, Linda, son, Scott, a daughter, Christina, a stepdaughter, Alissa, and their families. A public memorial service will be held at a later date, his wife said.

WPLJ'S Todd Pettengill And 'The Smithereens' To Headline Concert For Man Killed By Gunman

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 27TH, 2014 –– WPLJ 95.5 morning host, Todd Pettengill, will host "A Concert for Brendan," to raise proceeds for the Brendan Patrick Tevlin. According to nj.com, Tevlin, 19, a Livingston native, was killed on June 25 by an armed gunman Ali Muhammad Brown. Seton Hall Prep will name the Lacrosse field at Kelly Athletic Center after Tevlin. A popular New Jersey-based band, The Smithereens will headline the concert. After referring to the killing as evidence of “domestic terrorism,” Pettengill, of WPLJ’s “The Todd Show,” will emcee the Nov. 30 event being held in memory of 19-year-old Brendan Tevlin, who was fatally shot while sitting in his car at an intersection. The concert’s title – “Concert for Brendan – Good Vibes & Easy Living” – includes what Tevlin’s mother, Allison, has said was his personal motto. Using the same phrase, Tevlin’s supporters have set up a Twitter account to remember him, share inspirational quotes and promote upcoming events, including the concert.

Benztown Releases First-Ever Benztown 50 Voice Power Index

THE MOUTH, OCTOB ER 27TH, 2014 –– Benztown today released its Benztown 50 Voice Power Index, the first-ever industry ranking of the top 50 voiceover artists in the U.S. Benztown enlisted SparkNet Research & Consulting to compile and analyze industry data that was the foundation for the ranking. SparkNet ranked voiceover professionals against their industry peers across several criteria, including number of radio station affiliates, station size and market. More than 100 radio groups provided information for this exclusive annual ranking. The top VO artist is Pat Garrett (L). Dave “Chachi” Denes, President of Benztown, said: “This annual ranking of the most influential voice professionals in the U.S. is an idea whose time has come. As an industry leader in producing quality radio voiceover and imaging, we believe it’s important to shine a light on the value of voiceover to successful radio brands .. We congratulate and honor those talented individuals who comprise this inaugural index. We’re excited about making next year’s index even more robust.” The following voiceover professionals comprise the 2014 Benztown 50 Voice Power Index. They will be honored at a reception next April at the Worldwide Radio Summit in Hollywood. Making the list are 1. Pat Garrett 2. Scott Fisher 3. Cousin Deke 4. George W Robinson 5. John Willyard 6. Jeff Berlin 7. Harry Legg 8. Scott Matthews 9. Chad Erickson 10. Rachel McGrath 11. Steve Kamer 12. Sean Caldwell 13. Howard Cogan 14. Randy Reeves 15. Dr. Dave Ferguson 16. Dave Kampel 17. Matt Anthony 18. Chris Corley 19. Rick Party 20. Rich Van Slyke 21. Heather Walters 22. Jim Conrad 23. Tom Pagnotti 24. Jake Kaplan 25. Jim Merkel 26. Wendy K Gray 27. Dave Steele 28. Jude Corbett 29. Allan Peck 30. John Reilly 31. Drake Donovan 32. Mike Muscatello 33. Jeff Laurence 34. Jeff Davis 35. Randy Cox 36. Dave Morris 37. Neil Wilson 38. Austin Keyes 39. Mitch Craig 40. Joe Cipriano 41. Steve Stone 42. Mike Blakeney 43. Apollo 44. Ann Dewig 45. Chuck Matthews 46. Amber Cotton 47. Cayman Kelly 48. Donna Frank 49. Ben Blankenship 50. Pete Gustin. SEE MORE HERE

Bobby Bone's Band Performs Sold Out Shows For The Troops

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 27TH, 2014 –– Bobby Bones, host of the Premiere syndicated 'The Bobby Bones Show, and his band “The Raging idiots” played 2 sold out shows this weekend. One in Albuquerque and another in ElPaso for the the charity: Wounded Warriors. He tells Jockline "On Saturday, we travelled to FT. Bliss and played a Raging Idiots show for the troops. I also hung out and met a lot of our listeners that are on base. To date the Raging Idiots have made close to $600,000 for charities. The band has been playing for about a year and Jockline hears they'll soon be signing a record deal. we are going to sign one soon.

[LISTEN] The Man Who Gave Us '7 Dirty Words', George Carlin, Gets Street Named After Him In Manhattan

41 years ago that Carlin caught the attention of the FCC when a routine called “Filthy Words” on his album “Occupation: Foole” was played uncensored on NYC station WBAI

THE MOUTH, OCTOBER 27TH, 2014 –– More than six years after George Carlin died, he’s now getting a street named after him in his old neighborhood in Manhattan. According to The New York Daily News, last week a section of West 121st St. in Morningside Heights, near where the comedian grew up, was renamed “George Carlin Way.” That’s where Carlin, who was 71 when he died in 2008, lived as a kid. Corpus Christi Church, also on that block, had opposed the change. Carlin had attended the church’s school and often targeted it in his humor. It was 41 years ago that Carlin caught the attention of the FCC when a routine called “Filthy Words” on his album “Occupation: Foole” was played uncensored on NYC station WBAI on Oct . 30, 1973. The telecast led to an indecency case that the federal agency took all the way to the Supreme Court. Ultimately, the skirmish helped set government guidelines for what words are unsuitable for broadcasts. Carlin began as a radio host on KJOE/Shreveport, LA and later KDAY/LA before launching his famous comedy album which poked fun at his radio career in "Wonderful WINO!" LISTEN HERE

NETWORKS: Westar Music Launches New Website; KVAS Portland Joins Envision Sports Nework

THE MOUTH, OCTOB ER 27TH, 2014 –– Envision Networks®’ Westar Music Library is thrilled to reveal its newly updated website at WestarMusic.com. The new interface for Westar Music features a streamlined experience for users to search, organize and download thousands of royalty-free music tracks and sound effects. “With new features and benefits that our users asked for, we believe the new WestarMusic.com is quite simply the most seamless, easiest to navigate website available for high quality production music and professional sound effects,” said Westar Music sales manager Peter Alexander. Though massive in size, the Westar Music Library is easily searchable and allows you to combine music categories, musical styles, instrumentation, and tempo to find the right track. Selections from this world-class library can be heard on such major broadcast networks as ESPN, Cartoon Network, CNN, HGTV, TBS, The Travel Channel and more. ####### Envision Networks® is proud to welcome Ohana Media Group’s KVAS/Portland, OR as the newest affiliate of 'Where Are They Now' with Ahmad Rashad, the daily 60-second vignette that tracks down all of the big names in sports and gives you their whereabouts since leaving the game. With KVAS 1230 The Spirit of the West now broadcasting Where Are They Now with Ahmad Rashad, the station joins over 100 affiliates on the Envision Sports Network. For more information on Where Are They Now with Ahmad Rashad contact Valerie Brooks at 216-831-3761 or ValerieB@envisionradio.com.
